data.name: DescBOPP
data.value: A simplified Property Package for quick process calculations involving petroleum fluids characterized by simple properties like specific gravities and gas-oil ratio.

data.name: DescCOPP
data.value: A CAPE-OPEN Property Package is a complete, consistent, reusable, ready-to-use collection of methods, Compounds and model parameters for calculating any of a set of known Physical Properties for the Phases of a Material. It includes all the pure Compound methods and data, together with the relevant mixing rules and interaction parameters. A Property Package normally covers only a small subset of the Compounds and methods accessible through a Physical Properties System.

data.name: DescCPPP
data.value: CoolProp is an open-source database of fluid and humid air properties, formulated based on the most accurate formulations in open literature. It has been validated against the most accurate data available from the relevant references.

data.name: DescCSLKPP
data.value: Uses the empirical model of Chao and Seader for the calculation of VLE K-values. All other thermodynamic properties are calculated by the Lee-Kesler model.

data.name: DescCSPP
data.value: Liquid Phase Activity Coefficients are predicted by the COSMO-SAC JCOSMO implementation of Rafael Soares and Renan Gerber. Enthalpies, Entropies and Heat Capacities (both phases) are calculated by the Lee-Kesler method. The remaining properties, including vapor phase Fugacity Coefficients (optionally), are calculated using the Peng-Robinson EOS.

data.name: DescEUPP
data.value: This model is a combination of the extended UNIQUAC model for electrolytes and the Soave–Redlich–Kwong cubic equation of state. The model has been applied to aqueous systems containing ammonia and/or carbon dioxide along with various salts. Model parameters valid in the temperature range 0–110°C, the pressure range from 0–100 bar, and the concentration range up to approximately 80 molal ammonia are given. The model parameters were evaluated on the basis of more than 7000 experimental data points.

data.name: DescFPP
data.value:
FPROPS is a free open-source C-based library for high-accuracy evaluation of thermodynamic properties for a number of pure substances. It makes use of published data for the Helmholtz fundamental equation for those substances.
FPROPS is Copyright (C) 2011 - Carnegie Mellon University

data.name: DescGSLKPP
data.value: Uses the empirical model of Grayson and Streed for the calculation of VLE K-values. All remaining thermodynamic properties are calculated by the Lee-Kesler model.

data.name: DescLKPPP
data.value: Based on the Corresponding States Theory, the Lee-Kesler equation was enhanced by Plöcker to calculate component fugacities in asymmetric mixtures. In this Property Package, all thermodynamic properties - including K-values - are calculated by the LKP equation.

data.name: DescMUPP
data.value: Liquid phase Activity Coefficients are calculated by the Modified UNIFAC (Dortmund) method. Enthalpies, Entropies and Heat Capacities (both phases) are calculated by the Lee-Kesler method. The remaining properties, including vapor phase Fugacity Coefficients (optionally), are calculated using the Peng-Robinson EOS.

data.name: DescNRTLPP
data.value: In this Property Package, the NRTL (Non-Random Two-Liquid) model is used to calculate liquid-phase activity coefficients. Enthalpies are calculated by the Lee-Kesler model, while vapor-phase fugacities (optionally) and other thermodynamic properties (both phases) are calculated by the Peng-Robinson EOS.

data.name: DescNUPP
data.value: New modified UNIFAC property prediction model parameters are reported for 89 main groups and 984 group–group interactions by using critically evaluated phase equilibrium data including vapor–liquid equilibrium (VLE), liquid–liquid equilibrium (LLE), solid–liquid equilibrium (SLE), excess enthalpy (HE), infinite dilution activity coefficient (AINF) and excess heat capacity (CPE) data. Obtained parameters are recommended primarily for correlations of the VLE data.

data.name: DescPCSAFTPP
data.value:
The Perturbed Chain SAFT model is a state-of-the-art, engineering-like equation of state. It is designed for modelling mixtures of all types of substances: gases, solvents and polymers.
Perturbed-Chain SAFT is suitable for the calculation of phase equilibria and thermophysical properties of pure components and mixtures. It has been tested against experimental data for numerous systems and found to give excellent results. When compared to other equations of state, we find Perturbed-Chain SAFT to be more precise for correlation of experimental data and more predictive when applied to mixtures. It is very reliable for extrapolations over the regions where parameters were fitted.
* General Info *
DWSIM's implementation is based on the FORTRAN program which can be downloaded at http://www.th.bci.tu-dortmund.de/de/forschung/pc-saft.
*** Important ***
- This implementation doesn't contain the association term! - The calculated Cp/Cv is actually Cp/(Cp-R)

data.name: DescPengRobinsonIWVTPP
data.value: This Property Package uses the Peng-Robinson EOS taking water as an immiscible component. Also takes into account the volume translation coefficient for a better prediction of liquid volume densities, when applicable. Recommended only for water-hydrocarbon systems.

data.name: DescPengRobinsonMP
data.value: Peng-Robinson Property Package with support for more than one liquid phase.

data.name: DescPengRobinsonPP
data.value: Property Package that uses the Peng-Robinson Cubic Equation of State. Recommended for use with hydrocarbons and non-condensables.

data.name: DescPRLK
data.value: In this Property Package, Enthalpies, Entropies and Heat Capacities are calculated from the Lee-Kesler model.

data.name: DescPRSV2PP
data.value:
PRSV2 EOS with three pure compound parameters (k1, k2 and k3) and two Margules-type binary interaction parameters (kij and kji).
A modification to the attraction term in the Peng-Robinson equation of state published by Stryjek and Vera in 1986 (PRSV) significantly improved the model's accuracy by introducing an adjustable pure component parameter and by modifying the polynomial fit of the acentric factor. A subsequent modification published in 1986 (PRSV2) further improved the model's accuracy by introducing two additional pure component parameters to the previous attraction term modification.
PRSV2 is particularly advantageous for VLE calculations. While PRSV1 does offer an advantage over the Peng-Robinson model for describing thermodynamic behavior, it is still not accurate enough, in general, for phase equilibrium calculations.

data.name: DescPRSV2VLPP
data.value:
PRSV2 EOS with three pure compound parameters (k1, k2 and k3) and two Van Laar-type binary interaction parameters (kij and kji).
A modification to the attraction term in the Peng-Robinson equation of state published by Stryjek and Vera in 1986 (PRSV) significantly improved the model's accuracy by introducing an adjustable pure component parameter and by modifying the polynomial fit of the acentric factor. A subsequent modification published in 1986 (PRSV2) further improved the model's accuracy by introducing two additional pure component parameters to the previous attraction term modification.
PRSV2 is particularly advantageous for VLE calculations. While PRSV1 does offer an advantage over the Peng-Robinson model for describing thermodynamic behavior, it is still not accurate enough, in general, for phase equilibrium calculations.

data.name: DescPRWSPP
data.value: Uses the Peng-Robinson EOS with Wong-Sandler mixing rule. The excess Gibbs energy (GE/RT) is calculated from the UNIFAC model. Recommended for use with binary or ternary mixtures of polar components at high pressures and temperatures.

data.name: Descrio1
data.value: 1. Description

data.name: DescRPP
data.value: Reference Property Package (Ideal Gas/Solution).

data.name: DescSEAPP
data.value: This Property Package contains routines to calculate seawater properties using the procedures of the IAPWS-08 specification ("Release on the IAPWS Formulation 2008 for the Thermodynamic Properties of Seawater").

data.name: DescSoaveRedlichKwongSRK
data.value: Property Package that uses the Soave-Redlich-Kwong Cubic Equation of State. Recommended for use with hydrocarbons and non-condensables.

data.name: DescSourWaterPP
data.value:
The Sour Water Property Package is based on the SWEQ model described in the USEPA Report EPA-600/2-80-067: 'A new correlation of NH3, CO2, and H2S volatility data from aqueous sour water systems', by Wilson, Grant M., available online at http://nepis.epa.gov/Exe/ZyPDF.cgi?Dockey=9101B309.PDF
In this model, chemical and physical equilibria of NH3, CO2, and H2S in sour water systems including the effects of release by caustic (NaOH) addition are considered. The original model is applicable for temperatures between 20°C (68°F) and 140°C (285°F), and pressures up to 50 psi. in DWSIM, use of the PR EOS to correct vapour phase non-idealities extends this range but, due to lack of experimental data, exact ranges cannot be specified.

data.name: DescSRKMP
data.value: Soave-Redlich-Kwong Property Package with support for more than one liquid phase.

data.name: DescSteamTablesPP
data.value: Property Package for Water using IAPWS-97 property tables.

data.name: DescUNIQUACPP
data.value: In this Property Package, the UNIQUAC model is used to calculate liquid-phase activity coefficients. Enthalpies are calculated by the Lee-Kesler model, while vapor-phase fugacities (optionally) and other thermodynamic properties (both phases) are calculated by the Peng-Robinson EOS.

data.name: DescUPP
data.value: Property Package that uses the UNIFAC Group Contribution Method for equilibrium calculations. Recommended for use with Hypotheticals.

data.name: PP_ENTH_CP_CALC_METHOD
data.value: Enthalpy/Entropy/Cp calculation method (0 = Lee-Kesler, 1 = Ideal, 2 = Excess, 3 = Experimental)

data.name: PP_FLASHALGORITHM
data.value: Flash Algorithm (2 = Global Def., 0 = NL VLE, 1 = IO VLE, 3 = IO VLLE, 4 = Gibbs VLE, 5 = Gibbs VLLE, 6 = NL VLLE, 7 = NL SLE, 8 = NL Immisc., 9 = Simple LLE)

data.name: PP_FLASHALGORITHMFASTMODE
data.value: Enable Flash Algorithm Fast Mode

data.name: PP_FLASHALGORITHMIDEALKFALLBACK
data.value: Fallback to ideal K on trivial solution

data.name: PP_IDEAL_MIXRULE_LIQDENS
data.value: Use Ideal Mixing Rule for Liquid Phase Density (0 = Disable, 1 = Enable)

data.name: PP_IDEAL_VAPOR_PHASE_FUG
data.value: Use Ideal Vapor Phase Fugacity Model (0 = Disable, 1 = Enable)

data.name: PP_IGNORE_SALINITY_LIMIT
data.value: Ignore maximum salinity limit

data.name: PP_PHFELT
data.value: PH Flash - External Loop Tolerance

data.name: PP_PHFILT
data.value: PH Flash - Internal Loop Tolerance

data.name: PP_PHFMEI
data.value: PH Flash - Maximum External Iterations

data.name: PP_PHFMII
data.value: PH Flash - Maximum Internal Iterations

data.name: PP_PSFELT
data.value: PS Flash - External Loop Tolerance

data.name: PP_PSFILT
data.value: PS Flash - Internal Loop Tolerance

data.name: PP_PSFMEI
data.value: PS Flash - Maximum External Iterations

data.name: PP_PSFMII
data.value: PS Flash - Maximum Internal Iterations

data.name: PP_PTFELT
data.value: PT/PV Flash - External Loop Tolerance

data.name: PP_PTFILT
data.value: PT/PV Flash - Internal Loop Tolerance

data.name: PP_PTFMEI
data.value: PT/PV Flash - Maximum External Iterations

data.name: PP_PTFMII
data.value: PT/PV Flash - Maximum Internal Iterations

data.name: PP_RIG_BUB_DEW_FLASH_INIT
data.value: Use Rigorous Bubble and Dew Points for TP Flash Vapor Fraction Initialization (0 = Disable, 1 = Enable)

data.name: PP_USEEXPLIQDENS
data.value: Use Experimental Liquid Density Data (0 = Disable, 1 = Enable)

data.name: PP_USEEXPLIQTHERMALCOND
data.value: Use Experimental Liquid Thermal Conductivity Data (0 = Disable, 1 = Enable)

data.name: PP_USE_EOS_LIQDENS
data.value: Use EOS for Liquid Density (0 = Disable, 1 = Enable)

data.name: PP_USE_EOS_VOLUME_SHIFT
data.value: Use Peneloux Volume Translation correction (0 = Disable, 1 = Enable)

data.name: ParallelPInvokeError
data.value: The CPU Parallel Processing feature has been automatically disabled so that a native C++ library can be used by DWSIM. Please try to perform the calculation again. To re-enable the CPU Parallel Processing feature, go to 'DWSIM Launcher' window, 'File'/'DWSIM'> 'Global Settings'> 'Solver' in the new interface or 'Edit'> 'General Settings'> 'Solver' in the classic interface.

data.name: PropPack_FlashError
data.value: Phase equilibria calculation error.

data.name: PropPack_FlashMaxIt
data.value: PT/PV/TV Flash: Maximum number of iterations reached.

data.name: PropPack_FlashMaxIt2
data.value: PT/PV/TV Flash: Maximum number of iterations reached.

data.name: PropPack_FlashPHInternalLoopError
data.value: PH Flash: Error calculating equilibrium temperature.

data.name: PropPack_FlashPHMaxExtIt
data.value: PH Flash: Maximum number of external iterations reached.

data.name: PropPack_FlashPHMaxIntIt
data.value: PH Flash: Maximum number of internal iterations reached.

data.name: PropPack_FlasHPHTempError
data.value: PH Flash: Error calculating equilibrium temperature.

data.name: PropPack_FlashPSFError
data.value: PSF Flash is not supported.

data.name: PropPack_FlashPSInternalLoopError
data.value: PS Flash: Error calculating equilibrium temperature.

data.name: PropPack_FlashPSMaxExtIt
data.value: PS Flash: Maximum number of external iterations reached.

data.name: PropPack_FlashPSMaxIntIt
data.value: PS Flash: Maximum number of internal iterations reached.

data.name: PropPack_FlasHPSTempError
data.value: PS Flash: Error calculating equilibrium temperature.

data.name: PropPack_FlashPVNotSupported
data.value: PV Flash is not supported by this Property Package.

data.name: PropPack_FlashTHNotSupported
data.value: TH Flash is not supported by this Property Package.

data.name: PropPack_FlashTPVapFracError
data.value: PT Flash: Error calculating amount of the vapor phase in the mixture.

data.name: PropPack_FlashTrivialSolution
data.value: The Flash algorithm converged to the trivial solution. Try to calculate the stream with slightly perturbed temperature and/or pressure conditions or use another Property Package.

data.name: PropPack_FlashTSNotSupported
data.value: TS Flash is not supported.

data.name: PropPack_ZError
data.value: Error calculating compressibility factor.

data.name: ErrorInvalidFlashSpecValue
data.value: One or more flash specification values are invalid. Please check the associated Unit Operation or Material Stream for incorrect specifications or miscalculated values.

data.name: PP_IGNORE_VAPOR_FRACTION_LIMIT
data.value: Ignore Vapor Fraction bounds (0 <= VF <= 1) on flash calculations

data.name: MSTR_Desc
data.value: Contains information about compounds flowing at specified state conditions

data.name: MSTR_Name
data.value: Material Stream

data.name: PP_POYNTING
data.value: Use Poynting Correction Factor for liquid phase compound fugacities (0 = Disable, 1 = Enable)

data.name: PP_EXP_LIQDENS_PCORRECTION
data.value: Use Compressed Experimental Liquid Density Correction

data.name: PP_LIQVISC_PCORRECTION
data.value: Use Compressed Liquid Viscosity Correction
